ArticleTitle.sentence: E2F-1 and a cyclin-like DNA repair enzyme, uracil-DNA glycosylase, provide evidence for an autoregulatory mechanism for transcription.

event.clue: E2F-1 and a cyclin-like DNA repair enzyme, uracil-DNA glycosylase, provide evidence for an autoregulatory mechanism for transcription.
E2F-1 and a cyclin-like DNA repair enzyme, uracil-DNA glycosylase, provide evidence for an autoregulatory mechanism for transcription.

event.comment: NER: T4 del "autoregulatory mechanism for transcription"

AbstractText.sentence: The cell cycle-dependent transcription factor, E2F-1, regulates the cyclin-like species of the DNA repair enzyme uracil-DNA glycosylase (UDG) gene in human osteosarcoma (Saos-2) cells.

event.clue: The cell cycle-dependent transcription factor, E2F-1, regulates the cyclin-like species of the DNA repair enzyme uracil-DNA glycosylase (UDG) gene in human osteosarcoma (Saos-2) cells.

AbstractText.sentence: We demonstrate, through the deletion of the human UDG promoter sequences, that expression of E2F-1 activates the UDG promoter through several E2F sites.

event.clue: We demonstrate, through the deletion of the human UDG promoter sequences, that expression of E2F-1 activates the UDG promoter through several E2F sites.
We demonstrate, through the deletion of the human UDG promoter sequences, that expression of E2F-1 activates the UDG promoter through several E2F sites.
We demonstrate, through the deletion of the human UDG promoter sequences, that expression of E2F-1 activates the UDG promoter through several E2F sites.

AbstractText.sentence: The major putative downstream site for E2F, located in the first exon, serves as a target for E2F-1/DP1 complex binding in vitro.

event.clue: The major putative downstream site for E2F, located in the first exon, serves as a target for E2F-1/DP1 complex binding in vitro.
The major putative downstream site for E2F, located in the first exon, serves as a target for E2F-1/DP1 complex binding in vitro.

AbstractText.sentence: We also provide evidence for the functional relationship between the cyclin-like UDG gene product and E2F.

event.clue: We also provide evidence for the functional relationship between the cyclin-like UDG gene product and E2F.
We also provide evidence for the functional relationship between the cyclin-like UDG gene product and E2F.

AbstractText.sentence: High levels of UDG expression in a transient transfection assay result in the down-regulation of transcriptional activity through elements specific for E2F-mediated transcription.

event.clue: High levels of UDG expression in a transient transfection assay result in the down-regulation of transcriptional activity through elements specific for E2F-mediated transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: Overexpression of UDG in Saos 2 cells was observed to delay growth late in G1 phase and transiently arrest these cells from progressing into the S phase.

event.clue: Overexpression of UDG in Saos 2 cells was observed to delay growth late in G1 phase and transiently arrest these cells from progressing into the S phase.

AbstractText.sentence: This hypothetical model integrates one mechanism of DNA repair with the cell cycle control of gene transcription, likely through E2F.

event.clue: This hypothetical model integrates one mechanism of DNA repair with the cell cycle control of gene transcription, likely through E2F.

AbstractText.sentence: This implicates E2F as a multifunctional target for proteins and enzymes, possibly, responsive to DNA damage through the negative effect of UDG on E2F-mediated transcriptional activity.
